Description: Gold pectoral ornament with human profiles and pendant discs. The eyes were originally inlaid.
Curator's comments: Made on Crete, or by immigrant Cretan craftsmen on Aegina.
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (761)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2008-2009 18 Nov-15 Mar, New York, Metropolitan Museum of Art, 'Beyond Babylon: Art, Trade, and Diplomacy in the Second Millennium B.C.' 2018 27 Mar-9 Sep, Los Angeles, Getty Centre, Egypt-Greece-Rome: Cultures in Contact
